author: Brandon Reznik
comment: It works but only for turning lights on and off from their previous color. I haven't figured out how to change the color of the lights using this app or my watch. Also I don't like how it will always stay on the watch and never close out automatically and go back to the watch face. I have to manually clear it or it will stay on forever draining the battery with the bright white setting screen. Anytime I try to open the 'rooms settings activity' from the watch it crashes

reply.author: Nice Watch
reply.content:
Hi Brandon
Thanks for your review you raise some good suggestions and we will look into making these changes in the next version. For now you can turn lights on and off and also use the dimmer function.
Thanks for the feedback!

comment: The UI is horrendous. It shows lights and rooms mixed up together which in itself makes it hard to manage. On a Sony SmartWatch 3 the names of lights and rooms are also cut off. "Living room Left" turns into "Living room" with "room" cut horizontally. Impossible to identify lights and rooms without trial. When activating a light it activates with full brightness instead of using previous values like every other app. Still, all in all it gets the job done until Philips hopefully makes their own app.
title: Gets the job done, somewhat..

author: Bill Ebbecke
comment: App works, but display barely shows 1 group if lights.  In response to reply: Thank you for the quick reply, and I appreciate that. Also, at least on my watch, the app often hangs (circle keeps spinning) until I close out of the app and relaunch.

reply.author: Nice Watch
reply.content:
Hey Bill, thanks for the review. We will be making some interface updates with the next update. 
Thanks!

author: Mike Pettit
comment: The app may have a few rough edges but it works and works well, it's a godsend when you just want to switch a light group on or off which is normally all you want to do.

reply.author: Nice Watch
reply.content: Thanks Mike! Glad you find it useful.

title: Super Useful

author: CaptTM Ace
comment: Update of 6-24-16 with my new hue bridge 2.0 the app works perfectly now. Perviously some reason it did not work on the hue bridge 1.0 with my Nexus 6 and moto 360 1st gen but it's working now with them on the new hue bridge 2.0

reply.author: Nice Watch
reply.content: Great! Thanks for the review. Much appreciated.

title: Will work with Moto 360 1st gen / Nexus 6 with bridge 2.0

author: Marky Marc
comment: Was working before the most recent update. Did give some trouble initially but a reinstall fixed it. With the most recent update it works on my phone, but crashes on my watch. I see the circle loading but then right after it crashes.I tried to uninstalling and reinstalling, to no avail. Update fixed it

reply.author: Nice Watch
reply.content:
Hi Marc
I am glad that a reinstall got it working for you! Thanks for the review.

title: Doesn't work on Huawei Watch /6p

comment: Just what I've been looking for since the app I used to use got abandoned and stopped working :)
title: So happy!

author: Shane O'Brien
comment: Does not work with Wear 2.0 on LG G Watch R

reply.author: Nice Watch
reply.content: You can request a refund if it does not work for you, however it should work as expected on most devices.

reply.author: Nice Watch
reply.content: Thanks for updating your review Alan. Glad the new update works for you. :D

author: Sherry Howell
comment: Works well.  I like it for an alternative to buying switches for groups.  Great for the garage light 😉
title: G watch

author: stuart sosa
comment: Can you please tell me how to install the app in my Samsung gear

author: Thomas Wade
comment: Does not function for Android Wear 2.0

author: Guy Myers
comment: It works. Does exactly what it is supposed to do.

reply.author: Nice Watch
reply.content: Thanks for the review.  We appreciate it!

author: Tudor
comment: Finally a hue app for the watch.. Works great, thanks!

reply.author: Nice Watch
reply.content: Thanks for the great review! Glad you like it.

title: Awesome

author: Tom D'Roza
comment: Layout issues on my SW3. Overlapping text, not using the full width of the screen. Shows promise but needs the UI sorting out for all devices

reply.author: Nice Watch
reply.content:
Hi Tom
Our developers will investigate this right away and we will update the reply once the fix has been implemented.
Thanks for the review!

*Update
Hi Tom, we made some updates and released a new version yesterday. Please update the app and let us know if you are still having issues.
Thanks

title: Issues on Sony Smartwatch 3
